meanings.def: without anyone trying to prevent or control something
examples: the country’s first freely elected president
EU citizens can travel freely between member states.
Prices are higher than they would be if market forces were allowed to operate freely.

meanings.def: without anything stopping the movement or flow of something
examples: When the gate is raised, the water can flow freely.
Traffic is now moving more freely following an earlier accident.
The book is now freely available in the shops (= it is not difficult to get a copy).
Once into the open street they could breathe more freely.
(figurative) The wine flowed freely (= there was a lot of it to drink).

meanings.def: in an honest way without worrying about what people will say or do
examples: For the first time he was able to speak freely without the fear of reprisals against his family.

meanings.def: without trying to avoid the truth even though it might be unpleasant or embarrassing
examples: I freely admit that I made a mistake.
Both players freely acknowledge that money was a major incentive.

meanings.def: in a willing and generous way
examples: Millions of people gave freely in response to the appeal for the victims of the earthquake.
She has always given freely of her time.

meanings.def: a piece of writing that is translated freely is not translated exactly but the general meaning is given
